div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 2119 Contessa, 15 km. SW of Corleone, (261) 1888 Burial: 390-380 B.C. (Jenkins) Contents: 113 AR Rhegium: 2 tetradr. (latest as Herzfelder 78b) Acragas: 2 tetradr. Camarina: 1 tetradr. Catana: 4 tetradr. Eryx: 5 tetradr. (all from same obv. die) Gela: 10 tetradr. (to Jenkins 400) Himera: 1 tetradr. Leontini: 3 tetradr. Messana: 16 tetradr. Motya: 6 tetradr. Segesta: 2 tetradr. Selinus: 1 tetradr. Syracuse: 4 decadr. (1 Cimon; 3 Euaine- tos) 27 tetradr. (to Tudeer, Per. III) Siculo-Punic: 14 tetradr. (horse/palm-tree) Ziz: 10 tetradr. (incl. 8 from same obv. die with hippocamp symbol) Leucas: 2 st. (cantharus and ivy-branch symbols, both same obv. die) Athens: 3 tetradr. (4th cent.) Disposition: Palermo â€ Salinas, NSc 1888, pp. 302-13, illus. Evans, NC 1891, pp. 268-70, 364-73 Tusa Cutroni, AIIN 1956, p. 208, no. X (adds 12 pieces to Salinas list) Jenkins, Gela, p. 149
